content:
=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Here’s a plain‐English breakdown of the game based on its rules:

• Game Genre and Feel:
 – It’s a puzzle–platform arcade game with a Spelunky/Boulder Dash vibe. You navigate a maze–style level, collect resources, avoid hazards, and face roaming enemies while using environment–based mechanics (like falling boulders and destructible terrain).

• Core Mechanics:
 – Movement and Collision: Your avatar moves through a level made of tiles (walls, dirt, and a dark background). Some tiles and sprites (like dirt) can be “killed” (i.e. removed) using the sword, which acts as a tool or weapon.
 – Resource Collection: Diamonds are scattered through the level. Collecting one increases your score by 2 points. There’s a limit to how many may exist at a time (10 maximum).
 – Enemies and Hazards: You face a variety of moving threats. Random enemies wander around. There are creatures like crabs and butterflies that have their own interactions—the crab can kill a butterfly, and if a butterfly touches a crab, it might convert into a diamond (with a bonus point). Falling boulders pose a physical threat; if a boulder hits you from above, it can be used (or misused) to kill sprites at the cost of points.
 – Environmental Physics: Certain interactions (like boulders colliding with walls, dirt, or diamonds) cause them to “step back,” meaning there’s a built–in reaction to collisions that affects how things fall or bounce.

• Objective and Win/Loss Conditions:
 – Your primary goal is to collect diamonds and then reach the exit door. The exit door has a twist: when your avatar enters it, the door “kills” itself (i.e. it disappears, triggering your win) only if you have a sufficient amount of diamonds (specifically, you have to manage your resources so that you have more than a limit of 9 diamonds when interacting with it).
 – You lose if your avatar is eliminated (i.e. if the sprite count for your avatar drops to 0).

• Overall Strategy:
 1. Be methodical in your exploration: 
  – Conserve your sword’s power and use it to break through dirt if needed. Clear paths carefully so you don’t accidentally set off a falling boulder.
 2. Focus on collecting diamonds:
  – Not only do they boost your score, but they’re also essential for activating the door and winning the level.
  – Sometimes letting enemy interactions (like butterfly-crab encounters) play out might net you extra diamonds.
 3. Stay alert for hazards:
  – Watch out for boulders. If you can position yourself safely underneath one, it might help you eliminate a threat by “killing” it when falling, but if mismanaged it can be deadly.
  – Avoid direct confrontations with enemies when possible—or, if you dare, use your weapon or the environment to neutralize them.
 4. Plan your exit:
  – Once you have enough diamonds (aim for more than 9), make your way to the exit door. Ensure you’re not surrounded by hazards and that the door’s condition (and any other sprite interactions) won’t penalize you as you exit.
  – Timing is important, so clear any immediate threats before heading for the exit.

In summary, you’re a careful explorer whose mission is to navigate a treacherous environment, gather enough precious gems, and escape safely through a specially–conditioned exit. Balancing offense (using your sword), resource management (diamond collection), and defense (avoiding boulders and enemies) is key to mastering this game.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
background dirt -> '.'
background -> '-'
background exitdoor -> 'e'
background boulder -> 'o'
background diamond -> 'x'
background crab -> 'c'
background butterfly -> 'b'
boulder -> '@'
butterfly -> '#'
crab -> '$'
diamond -> '%'
dirt -> '&'
exitdoor -> '*'
wall -> 'b'
sword -> 'd'

Action:3

I'm moving right from (3,10) to (3,11), stepping into an empty cell to avoid the butterfly on my left while progressing toward areas with more diamonds.
